alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 4:26PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 500 PM MDT... At 425 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles east of Boyero, or 24 miles south of Flagler, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also likely occurring. Be prepared for sudden drops in visibility. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
